confidentiality.notes: It is unknown how much of the usual name, e-mail address, account number and so on that the marketing database contained. T-Mobile Czech Republic says only that it did not include location, traffic, or other "sensitive data such as passwords".  T-Mobile Czech Republic managing director Milan Vaina says there was "no actual data leak" adding that "data are (sic) safe". It is unclear if the company is claiming the records were for sale but remained not purchased.

discovery_notes: Although he was able to download the data, he then attempted to sell it to a buyer who happened to be a T-Mobile business partner, who immediately informed the mobile network of the data loss.
notes: A million and a half customer records have strolled out the door of T-Mobile Czech Republic in an employee's pocket; attempted to sell the datasets
summary: T-Mobile Employee Arrested for Trying to Sell Customer Data  T-Mobile Czech Republic says there was "no actual data leak" adding that "data are (sic) safe". It is unclear if the company is claiming the records were for sale but remained not purchased. Attempt was detected before the customer account details were handed over  The offending staffer was part of a "small team" which "worked with customer data".  There was also no word on how a single staffer, since sacked, could have had access to 1.5 million records and been able to siphon it off en masse.
